question:
Which of the following is the most widely used method for refining Impure metals?

SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (2nd shift)
solution:
• The most widely used method for refining impure metals is Electrolytic Refining.
  • In this method, the impure metal is made the anode, and a pure metal sheet is the cathode.
  • When electric current passes through the electrolyte solution containing metal ions, pure metal deposits on the cathode.
  • Impurities either settle down as anode mud or remain dissolved in the electrolyte.
  • This method yields highly pure metal and is extensively used for metals like copper, silver, gold, and zinc.

Additional Information:

  • Poling refining is an older method mainly for copper.
  • Vapour-phase and liquidation refining are specialized methods, less commonly used.

question:
Which is the most common ore of oxidized mercury that occurs in granular crusts or veins associated with volcanic activity and hot springs?

SSC MTS 06/09/2023 (2nd shift)
solution:
• The most common ore of oxidized mercury is Cinnabar.
  • Cinnabar is mercury sulfide (HgS) and is found in granular crusts or veins.
  • It commonly occurs in regions with volcanic activity and hot springs.
  • Diaspore, siderite, and corundum are ores of other minerals and not related to mercury.

Additional Information:

  • Cinnabar is the primary ore used for mercury extraction.
  • It has a distinctive bright red color and has been used historically as a pigment.

question:
The process in which metals are extracted from their ores by heating beyond the melting point is called ________ .

SSC MTS 09/05/2023 (Evening)
solution:
• The process of extracting metals from their ores by heating beyond their melting point is called Smelting.
  • Smelting involves heating the ore to high temperatures to separate the metal from impurities.
  • It is an essential step in metallurgical extraction for metals like iron, copper, and lead.
  • Options like spinning, heaving, and extracting are incorrect terms for this process.

Additional Information:

  • During smelting, a reducing agent like carbon is often used to remove oxygen from metal oxides.
  • The process produces molten metal and slag (waste material).

question:
Which of the following is the highest quality coal?

SSC CGL 01/12/2022 (2nd shift)
solution:
• The highest quality coal among the options is Anthracite.
  • Anthracite has the highest carbon content (86-97%) and lowest moisture content.
  • It burns cleanly with a high calorific value, producing more heat compared to other coals.
  • Lignite, bituminous, and peat have lower carbon content and lower energy output.

Additional Information:

  • Anthracite is hard, glossy, and has the highest energy content among coals.
  • It is used primarily in industries requiring high-grade fuel and cleaner combustion.

question:
Which of the following is a tough, porous and black substance, and almost a pure form of carbon?

SSC MTS 11/07/2022 (1st shift)
solution:
• The tough, porous, and black substance that is almost a pure form of carbon is Coke.
  • Coke is produced by heating coal in the absence of air (destructive distillation).
  • It is used as a fuel and as a reducing agent in metallurgical processes.
  • Bitumen, coal tar, and coal gas are different by-products of coal with different properties and uses.

Additional Information:

  • Coke has a high carbon content and burns with little smoke.
  • It is widely used in iron and steel industries.

question:
Dolomite is an ore of:

SSC MTS 20/10/2022 (1st shift)
solution:
• Dolomite is an ore of Magnesium.
  • Chemically, dolomite is calcium magnesium carbonate (CaMg(CO₃)₂).
  • It is used as a source of magnesium and also as a construction material.
  • Aluminium, potassium, and sodium have different ores.

Additional Information:

  • Dolomite is also used in the manufacture of refractory bricks and as a soil conditioner.
  • It is found in sedimentary rock formations.

question:
________ is a process of forming a thick oxide layer of aluminium.

SSC CHSL 12/08/2021 (1st shift)
solution:
• The process of forming a thick oxide layer of aluminium is called Anodising.
  • Anodising increases the thickness of the natural oxide layer on the surface of aluminium.
  • This process improves corrosion resistance and surface hardness.
  • Galvanisation is coating with zinc, ductility refers to metal's ability to stretch, and corrosion is the general degradation of metals.

Additional Information:

  • Anodised aluminium is widely used in aircraft, architectural structures, and consumer electronics.
  • It also allows colouring of the aluminium surface.

question:
Which of the following fibres is used to make rayon cloth?

SSC CHSL 12/08/2021 (2nd shift)
solution:
• The fibre used to make rayon cloth is Cellulose.
  • Rayon is a semi-synthetic fibre made from regenerated cellulose derived from wood pulp or cotton.
  • Gum, pectin, and mucilage are natural substances but not used for rayon production.

Additional Information:

  • Rayon is often called "artificial silk" because of its smooth texture.
  • It is widely used in textile industries for making clothes.

question:
According to a law postulated by ______ the amounts of different substances liberated by the same quantity of electricity passing through the electrolytic solution are proportional to their chemical equivalent weights.

SSC CPO 25/11/2020 (Evening)
solution:
• The law stating that the amounts of different substances liberated by the same quantity of electricity passing through an electrolytic solution are proportional to their chemical equivalent weights is Faraday's Law of Electrolysis.
  • This law was postulated by Michael Faraday.
  • It forms the basis for quantitative electrochemistry.
  • Joseph Fourier is known for heat conduction, John Dalton for atomic theory, and Alfred Nobel for inventing dynamite.

Additional Information:

  • Faraday’s laws of electrolysis help calculate the amount of substance produced or consumed at an electrode during electrolysis.
  • These laws are fundamental in electroplating and electrorefining processes.

question:
With reference to metals and their ores, which of the following pairs is INCORRECT?

SSC CHSL 13/10/2020 (1st shift)
solution:
• The incorrect pair is Mercury (Hg) – Greenockite.
  • Mercury’s common ore is Cinnabar (HgS), not Greenockite.
  • Greenockite is actually an ore of Cadmium (Cd).
  • Other pairs are correct:
    • Gold is found in Calaverite (gold telluride).
    • Aluminium is extracted from Cryolite (used as a flux in aluminium extraction).
    • Cobalt’s ore is Smaltite (not "Smelite"; likely a typo for Smaltite).

Additional Information:

  • Correct identification of ores is essential for proper extraction techniques.
  • Confusing ores can lead to inefficient extraction and processing.
